properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 9 at 3:20AM HST until January 11 at 7:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND NOW THROUGH
SATURDAY...

The Flash Flood Watch is now in effect for

* Maui and the Big Island.

* Through Saturday evening

* An unstable airmass will move over the islands today and into
the weekend, bringing an increase in enhanced showers across the
area but primarily the eastern islands. While showers will be
possible over most areas, the areas most susceptible to flooding
will be windward locations which have already received rain
this week.

* The extended period of rain could cause flooding in low spots
which could make some roadways impassable. Debris in streams
and gulches may clog bridges and culverts. Strong winds may
cause tree branches to fall which will potentially add to the
amount of debris.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions are favorable for flash
flooding. Flash flooding is LIFE THREATENING. Do not cross fast
flowing water in your vehicle or on foot.

Monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action if a Flash
Flood Warning is issued. If you experience heavy rain or rising
water, head to higher ground immediately.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING
